member.summary: The implementation of .
member.remarks: The implementation of . This class provides possibilities to perform OCR, to read data from input files and to return contained text in the required format. Also there are possibilities to use features of "tesseract" (optical character recognition engine for various operating systems).

member.name: M:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.AbstractTesseract4OcrEngine.DoTesseractOcr(System.IO.FileInfo,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.IO.FileInfo},iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.OutputFormat,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs tesseract OCR using command line tool or a wrapper for Tesseract OCR API.
member.remarks:
Performs tesseract OCR using command line tool or a wrapper for Tesseract OCR API. Please note that list of output files is accepted instead of a single file because page number parameter is not respected in case of TIFF images not requiring preprocessing. In other words, if the passed image is the TIFF image and according to the
no preprocessing is needed, each page of the TIFF image is OCRed and the number of output files in the list is expected to be same as number of pages in the image, otherwise, only one file is expected
member.param: of output files (one per each page)
number of page to be processed

member.name: M:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.AbstractTesseract4OcrEngine.DoTesseractOcr(System.IO.FileInfo,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.IO.FileInfo},iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.OutputFormat,System.Int32,System.Boolean)

Please note that list of output files is accepted instead of a single file because page number parameter is not respected in case of TIFF images not requiring preprocessing. In other words, if the passed image is the TIFF image and according to the
no preprocessing is needed, each page of the TIFF image is OCRed and the number of output files in the list is expected to be same as number of pages in the image, otherwise, only one file is expected
member.param: of output files (one per each page)
number of page to be processed

indicates if
needs to be dispatched

member.summary:
The implementation of
for tesseract OCR.
member.remarks:
The implementation of
for tesseract OCR. This class provides possibilities to use features of "tesseract" CL tool (optical character recognition engine for various operating systems). Please note that it's assumed that "tesseract" has already been installed locally.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.Tesseract4ExecutableOcrEngine.DoTesseractOcr(System.IO.FileInfo,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.IO.FileInfo},iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.OutputFormat,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs tesseract OCR using command line tool for the selected page of input image (by default 1st).
member.remarks:
Performs tesseract OCR using command line tool for the selected page of input image (by default 1st). Please note that list of output files is accepted instead of a single file because page number parameter is not respected in case of TIFF images not requiring preprocessing. In other words, if the passed image is the TIFF image and according to the
no preprocessing is needed, each page of the TIFF image is OCRed and the number of output files in the list is expected to be same as number of pages in the image, otherwise, only one file is expected
member.param: of output files (one per each page)
number of page to be processed

indicates if
needs to be dispatched

member.name: T:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.Tesseract4LibOcrEngine
member.summary:
The implementation of
for tesseract OCR.
member.remarks:
The implementation of
for tesseract OCR. This class provides possibilities to use features of "tesseract" using tess4j. Please note that this class is not thread-safe, in other words this Tesseract engine cannot be used for multithreaded processing. You should create one instance per thread

member.remarks:
Performs tesseract OCR using wrapper for Tesseract OCR API for the selected page of input image (by default 1st). Please note that list of output files is accepted instead of a single file because page number parameter is not respected in case of TIFF images not requiring preprocessing. In other words, if the passed image is the TIFF image and according to the
no preprocessing is needed, each page of the TIFF image is OCRed and the number of output files in the list is expected to be same as number of pages in the image, otherwise, only one file is expected
member.param: of output files (one per each page)
number of page to be processed

indicates if
needs to be dispatched

member.name: M:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.Tesseract4LibOcrEngine.ValidateTessDataPath(System.String)
member.summary: Validates Tess Data path, checks if tess data path contains only ASCII charset.
member.remarks: Validates Tess Data path, checks if tess data path contains only ASCII charset. Note: tesseract lib has issues with non ASCII characters in tess data path.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.Tesseract4LibOcrEngine.GetOcrResultForMultiPage(System.IO.FileInfo,iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.OutputFormat)
member.summary: Gets OCR result from provided multi-page image and returns result as list of strings for each page.
member.remarks: Gets OCR result from provided multi-page image and returns result as list of strings for each page. This method is used for tiff images when preprocessing is not needed.
member.returns: list of result string that will be written to a temporary files later

member.summary: Path to the file containing user words.
member.remarks: Path to the file containing user words. Each word should be on a new line, file should end with a newline character.

member.summary: Indicates if user words file is temporary and has to be removed.

member.name: F:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.Tesseract4OcrEngineProperties.useTxtToImproveHocrParsing
member.summary: Used to make HOCR recognition result more precise.
member.remarks: Used to make HOCR recognition result more precise. This is needed for cases of Thai language or some Chinese dialects where every character is interpreted as a single word. For more information see https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesseract/issues/2702

member.name: F:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.Tesseract4OcrEngineProperties.imagePreprocessingOptions
member.summary: Settings for image preprocessing.

member.name: F:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.Tesseract4OcrEngineProperties.minimalConfidenceLevel
member.summary: Minimal confidence level for HOCR line to be considered as properly recognized.
member.remarks: Minimal confidence level for HOCR line to be considered as properly recognized. If real confidence level is lower then line is ignored Default value is 0 which means that everything is considered as properly recognized Value may vary in range of 0-100

member.summary: Gets Page Segmentation Mode.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.Tesseract4OcrEngineProperties.SetPageSegMode(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Sets Page Segmentation Mode.
member.remarks: Sets Page Segmentation Mode. More detailed explanation about psm modes could be found here https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesseract/blob/master/doc/tesseract.1.asc#options Note that in documentation it is stated that default value of PSM is 3. This is true for tesseract executable, but for tesseract lib it is -1 which has negative impact on some documents. That's why in the code we set it explicitly to 3.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.Tesseract4OcrEngineProperties.IsPreprocessingImages

language as
, tessdata for this languages has to exist in tess data directory

member.name: M:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.Tesseract4OcrEngineProperties.IsUseTxtToImproveHocrParsing
member.summary: Gets .
member.remarks: Gets . Used to make HOCR recognition result more precise. This is needed for cases of Thai language or some Chinese dialects where every character is interpreted as a single word. For more information see https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesseract/issues/2702

member.summary: Gets minimal confidence level for HOCR line to be considered as properly recognized.
member.remarks: Gets minimal confidence level for HOCR line to be considered as properly recognized. If real confidence level is lower then line is ignored Default value is 0 which means that everything is considered as properly recognized Value may vary in range of 0-100

member.name: M:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.TesseractOcrUtil.SetTesseractProperties(Tesseract.TesseractEngine,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Sets tesseract properties.
member.remarks: Sets tesseract properties. The following properties are set in this method: In java: path to tess data, languages, psm In .Net: psm This means that other properties have been set during the initialization of tesseract instance previously or tesseract library doesn't provide such possibilities in api for .Net or java.
member.param: list of languages in required format as
path to a temporary file with user words

member.name: M:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.TesseractOcrUtil.InitializeTesseractInstance(System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates tesseract instance with parameters.
member.remarks: Creates tesseract instance with parameters. Method is used to initialize tesseract instance with parameters if it haven't been initialized yet. In this method in java 'tessData', 'languages' and 'userWordsFilePath' properties are unused as they will be set using setters in method. In .Net all these properties are needed to be provided in tesseract constructor in order to initialize tesseract instance.Thus, tesseract initialization takes place in constructor in java, but in .Net it happens only after all properties are validated, i.e. just before OCR process.
member.param: list of languages in required format as
true is current os is windows
path to a temporary file with user words

member.remarks: Returns true if tesseract instance has been already disposed. (used in .net version)
member.returns: true if tesseract instance is disposed.

member.name: T:iText.Pdfocr.Tesseract4.TextPositioning
member.summary: Enumeration of the possible types of text positioning.
member.remarks:
Enumeration of the possible types of text positioning. It is used when there is possibility in selected Reader to process the text by lines or by words and to return coordinates for the selected type of item. For tesseract this value makes sense only if selected
is .

member.summary: Similar to BY_WORDS mode, but top and bottom of word BBox are inherited from line.
